system.description: One of your senses is highly developed, allowing you to spot what others might miss. Choose one from sight, sound, touch, taste, and smell. When making an Awareness Test using that sense, the dice gained from Training is doubled.

You have a natural aptitude with the inner workings of intricate devices like locks, clockwork, automatons, gizmos, and gadgets. Double the bonus gained from Focus in the Skill when testing delicate internals.
system.requirements: Focus (1) in Dexterity, and Focus (1) in either Engineering or Technology

system.description: You are equally skilled at manipulating objects and wielding weapons in any hand. When you are dual-wielding, add a die (1d6) to your total dice pool before splitting the dice.
You have a natural affinity for animals. You have Advantage on Tests when trying to get an animal to follow your commands or earn its trust. You naturally know what might be causing it stress.
When you successfully hit a living creature with an attack, add 1 Damage for each 6 rolled. This additional Damage cannot exceed your Training or Focus in Medicine (whichever is higher).
If you make an Attack with a Subtle weapon and the target is unaware of you, the attack deals double Damage and ignores Armour.
If you fail a Test and one of the dice rolled was a 1, you can reroll the Test, but its Complexity increases by 1. Cannot reroll more than once. Must Take a Breather or Rest before using again.
When you succeed on a Presence Test against a target, any Fast Talk Tests other characters make against that target for the rest of the day double their Skill Training.
Once per mission, you can build yourself a common weapon or piece of spy gear in the field. Test uses Mind (Engineering or Technology) instead of Bureaucracy. The device breaks after an hour.
system.requirements: Training (1) and Focus (1) in Engineering or Technology

system.description: When rolling on the Computational Complication Table or Magical Mishap Table, you may spend 1 Luck to re-roll, but must abide by the second result.
When you make a Test to restore Toughness or remove Injuries from someone other than yourself, you double the dice gained from any Training in the tested Skill.
With a successful Spirit (Zeal) Test, your character can sense what can otherwise not be seen or heard. The DN is determined by the GM.
You have Advantage on Tests to programme, hack, or debug computer code.
You can immediately make a DN 6:1 Mind (Resolve) Test to resist the effects of becoming Stunned due to failing a Test or being supernaturally stricken with confusion.
You gain a +2 bonus to your Initiative and can never be Surprised in combat. You can take this Talent multiple times.
You don't suffer a penalty to Melee, Accuracy, or Defence when Blinded or attacked by a hidden creature.
You gain the ability to cast spells using computational sorcery or mental magic. Choose 4 spells you know how to cast.
When determining your Initiative, you may use your Body instead of Mind.
You have Advantage on Tests when attempting to escape someone's grasp. Additionally, you can fit into unusually small or cramped locations.
As an Action, target a creature in Close Range. Make a DN 4:1 Spirit (Presence) Test. Target recovers 1 Toughness per success. Can also treat Psychological Injuries during rest.
Once per turn, when an enemy hits you with a melee Attack, you can immediately use a Free Action to Attack that enemy if it is within range.
system.requirements: Focus (2) in Reflexes and Close Combat Skill

system.description: Choose a Zone and make a DN 4:1 Body (Ranged) Test. Enemies in that Zone make Opposed DN 4:1 Body (Reflexes) Test or suffer Damage equal to the difference in successes.
system.requirements: Training (1) or Focus (1) in Ranged Skill, a ranged weapon

system.description: You deal +1 Damage when you take the Called Shot Action.
system.requirements: Training (2) and Focus (2) in Ranged Skill

system.description: The Complexity of Tests you make to build new items (but not repair/modify existing ones) is reduced by 1.
system.requirements: Training (1) and Focus (1) in Engineering or Technology

system.description: You have Advantage on Tests when stealing or hiding illicit activities. Can easily track down black market dealers and illegal dens.
If you get a 6 on an attack with a Crushing weapon against a Large or smaller creature, the target is Stunned until the end of their next turn.
Any Tests when looking for clues or investigating are at Advantage.
Advantage on Tests to extrapolate intelligence from data sources. Taking an hour to immerse maximizes successes.
When you use an explosive or weapon with the Blast Trait, you can choose a number of targets equal to your Focus in Engineering to be unaffected.
When making a Bureaucracy Test to acquire information from other teams, add bonus dice equal to your Training in Fast Talk.
While your Adrenaline and Toughness are both at 0, you can use a Free Action to regain 1 Adrenaline. Once per round.
system.requirements: Spirit (3), Training (1) and Focus (1) in Resolve

system.description: Advantage on Tests to resolve conflicts, gauge moods, and tell if people are lying.
When you hit with an unarmed attack, you may choose to deal no Damage. If so, target makes a DN 4:S Body (Fortitude) Test. On failure, Blinded or Stunned.
As an Action, dispel a spell after it has been cast. DN is equal to the DN of the spell, Complexity is one higher.
Whenever you are involved in an on-foot Pursuit, you have Advantage on your Body (Athletics) Tests.
If only one enemy and no allies are within Close Range of you, your Melee and Defence increase one step against that enemy.
system.requirements: Training (2) and Focus (2) in Close Combat Skill

system.description: Advantage on Tests to deceive others. Unaffected by non-magical truth effects, and ignore Truth Geas cast at Level lower than your Training in Resolve.
You can recall moments from memory with near perfection. You can recall major elements without a test.
When interacting socially, add 1d6 to your dice pool for each level of Training in Intuition. When identifying a mood, double your Training in Intuition.
After using your Move to leave your Zone and enter another, your Defence increases by one step. Increase Defence by two steps when Dodging.
When driving, vehicle's Defence increases by one step. Ignore Speed penalty when piloting through Difficult Terrain.
All team members add 1 to their Initiative while they can see or hear you.
When you have a good vantage position, you can communicate with an ally as a Free Action to improve their Defence one step until your next turn.
When trying not to be spotted by people or cameras, any Stealth Test is at Advantage. Witnesses struggle to describe you.
Whenever you become Frightened or influenced against your will, you may immediately attempt a DN 6:1 Mind (Resolve) Test to resist.
When you successfully Grapple, Shove, or make a Called Shot to arms, you can disassemble their weapon as a Free Action.
Choose Academics, Occult, or Science. Double the dice gained from Training for that Skill. Failing the Test increases Threat by 1.
Difficulty of repairing a vehicle is reduced by 1. Can repair a wrecked vehicle one additional time during an adventure.
When you succeed on a Fast Talk Test, any Presence Tests other characters make against that target for the rest of the day double their Skill Training.
While wielding a ranged weapon in each hand, your Accuracy increases by one step.
system.requirements: Training (1) and Focus (1) in Ranged Skill

system.description: You gain +1 Toughness for each level of Training in the Resolve Skill.
The first time you fail a Death Test in combat, you do not increase the DN.
Your Unarmed strikes deal 1+S Damage, have the Crushing Trait, and lose the Ineffective Trait.
When you make a Help Action, the recipient of your aid adds one additional die to their pool.
Once per turn, if you deal Damage with a melee attack, you can move to an adjacent Zone as a Free Action.
Advantage on Tests to track, find, trap, or hunt. Choose a terrain type to always find secure rest.
When you throw an item or weapon, its Range increases one step.
system.requirements: Body (2), Training (1) or Focus (1) in Athletics

system.description: Once per session you can call on friends to gain Help worth +3d6 on an appropriate Test or perform a harmless task.
A sturdy tool or object loses the Ineffective Trait when you use it as an Improvised Weapon.
Can create improvised incendiaries during a Rest. Max carried equals combined Training/Focus in Engineering.
When coercing someone, use Mind instead of Body or Spirit, and add Training/Focus in Intuition to the Test.
Advantage on Tests to threaten, intimidate, cajole, and start arguments.
Double bonus from Training in Might when grip strength is involved. Ignore effects that make you drop items.
You can hold your breath and survive a lack of air for twice as long.
Immune to Weakened Conditions from toxins/smells, Advantage on Tests to resist poison and disease.
On a Called Shot from stealth with blunt weapon/hands, Incapacitate target instead of dealing Damage for minutes equal to Damage.
system.requirements: Training (2) in Stealth and Close Combat

system.description: Double dice from Training in Survival for navigation Tests in a chosen city.
You have a licence to drive a category of vehicle and own a basic civilian version (car/bike) or access to agency pool.
Can read lips within Long Range if you see the face.
Close combat weapons you wield gain the Reach Trait.
Advantage on Tests to disguise yourself. Creates an airtight cover persona.
Action to patch wounds (DN 4:1 Medicine) restores 1 Toughness per success. Treat Physical Injuries during rest.
system.requirements: Training (1) and Focus (1) in Medicine, suitable tools and supplies

system.description: Advantage on Academics Tests involving math. Negate Complexity penalty for mental magic.
Apply poison as a Free Action. Advantage to conceal it. Cannot accidentally poison yourself.
Advantage on Opposed Tests using rank to enter secure locations or pressure people. Can be bought multiple times.
Bury information so it's impossible to find. Opposed searchers face your Bureaucracy Test with Advantage.
Advantage on Technology Tests with your personal device. Device immune to possession below your Computer Training level.
Advantage on Tests to resolve situations when using the Talk It Out Action.
Roll 2d6 vs GM's 1d6 on Rest. Win = +2 Luck. Lose = Threat +1.
No Disadvantage on Tests relating to sight in low light or darkness.
Advantage to spot hidden enemies. Natural Awareness +1. No Defence penalty vs hidden attackers.
While within Close Range of an enemy, its Defence decreases one step against Attacks from anyone but you.
Once per round, make an Attack when an opponent attempts to move away from you.
Can always orient north. Find things in known spaces in 1 Action. Can adapt to alien spatial laws in 1 minute.
Delay your turn to act last, but increase Melee and Accuracy by one step.
Double the dice gained from Training in Engineering to fix something for one last use before it breaks fully.
Ignore a point of Armour for every 6 on an Attack with a Piercing weapon.
No penalty to Accuracy when using a ranged weapon at Close Range.
system.requirements: Training (1) and Focus (1) in Ranged Skill

system.description: Add 1d6 to Tests made during your first turn in combat.
If you roll a 6 on a melee Attack, use a Free Action to Shove the target (and optionally knock Prone).
You are an expert at creating project plans and assigning workloads.
Ignore the Reload Trait on any weapon you use.
Advantage on any Test when requisitioning items, filing paperwork, and expediting a request for support.
While wielding a melee weapon in each hand, your Melee increases by one step.
system.requirements: Training (1) and Focus (1) in Close Combat Skill

system.description: Advantage to locate lost/hidden items. Ignore Subtle penalties. Can catch a dropped item as a Free Action.
When you make an Attack with a ranged weapon, the weapon gains the Spread Trait.
system.requirements: Training (2) and Focus (2) in Ranged Skill

system.description: When you win an Opposed Test, add 1 success for each level of Training in Resolve.
Choose a specific subject to master. Double the dice from Training in Academics/Science for related Tests.
system.requirements: Training (1) and Focus (1) in Academics or Science

system.description: Identify and cast Level 5 spells (requires Computational Sorcerer or Traditional Magician).
If you get a 6 on an Attack with a Slashing weapon, target is Prone and takes 1 Damage (ignoring Armour) on Move.
system.requirements: Training (1) in Medicine, a Slashing weapon

system.description: Advantage on Tests to distract/misdirect, steal or hide items. Can conceal a palm-sized object even if searched.
Grants the driver an extra Action in a round without having to spend Adrenaline.
Read books in an hour. Fast study for temporary knowledge (piloting, spells) at Disadvantage.
When taking the Defend Action, Defence increases by one step. Advantage on Might Tests to block entry.
Once per round, when an enemy moves into your Zone, use a Free Action to make a ranged Attack against it.
Advantage on Tests when throwing your weight around to requisition equipment or boss someone around.
When firing from a moving vehicle, Accuracy increases one step. Can make Called Shots with vehicle weapons (Large targets).
Your Defence increases one step against Attacks made by enemies lower in the Initiative order than you.
When you take a Help Action, provide bonus dice from your Presence Training. Your voice is easily recognized.
Spend Action to study enemy in sight. Until next Rest, Defence increases one step against their attacks.
Ignore ground Difficult Terrain. Roll 1d6 when forced Prone; on a 6, stay standing. Stand up as Free Action.
Advantage on Tests where confidence is key (bluffing, threats, areas access). People accept your claims.
Action: Target ally can Attack an enemy. They add bonus dice equal to your Mind.
Action: Aim at target. Accuracy increases by steps equal to Focus in Dexterity for next attack.
Double the dice gained from Training when operating or repairing electronic technology/computers.
Double the dice gained from Training when making a Mind Test where you can take your time to think.
The Complexity of Tests to modify or repair existing items is reduced by 1.
Advantage on Endeavours. Let off with a warning the first time you fail Business As Usual.
Ability to cast traditional/mental magic. Choose 4 known spells.
If two or more enemies are within Close Range at start of turn, Melee increases one step.
Use Stealth instead of Presence for Body (Presence) Tests with Advantage. People ignore your conspicuous creeping.
Ignore Difficult Terrain when Charging. Add 1d6 to dice pool for the attack.
system.requirements: Body (3), Training (1) in Close Combat Skill

system.description: Melee increases one step when making an unarmed attack or using a Subtle melee weapon.
system.requirements: Training (1) and Focus (2) in Close Combat Skill

system.description: You can attempt to hide even when there is no cover or shadow.
When an enemy within Medium Range makes a Test, spend Adrenaline to remove dice equal to your Training in Zeal.
You are a skilled performer, but you have exceptional talent with one type of performance in particular.
You project authority and inspire trust. You have Advantage on Tests to instruct, direct, or persuade groups of people.
You are skilled at bargaining, haggling, and brokering contracts. You have Advantage on business deal Tests and failed bribes are less likely to be reported.
You stay current with local news and rumours. Gain Advantage on Tests to gather local gossip and you always recognize local celebrities.
